_description: Dance Connexions Class Information - All demographic content, styles, pricing, and FAQs

monthly.note: 4 classes per month, weekly recurring sessions

introFourSession.note: Intro pack for new students — commit when you're ready

dropIn.note: Try any class, any time, no commitment required

privateCouple.note: Private session for two — ideal for couples or duo practice

demographics.name: Kids
demographics.headline: Where Little Ones Fall in Love with Dance
demographics.subheadline: Fun, safe, and age-appropriate classes designed for children in Sunway.
demographics.overview: Our kids classes are designed for children aged 5 to 12, taught in a safe, encouraging environment where movement is explored through play and music. Classes are structured to be age-appropriate — building coordination, rhythm, and confidence without pressure or competition.
demographics.whatsappMessage:
Hi! I'm interested in kids dance classes at Dance Connexions.

- Child's age:
- Dance style interest:
- Any prior experience:

Could you share the schedule and fees? Thank you!
demographics.heroImagePrompt: Young Chinese Malaysian girl aged 7–9, joyful expression, colorful dance outfit, leaping or spinning in a bright mirrored dance studio in Malaysia, warm natural lighting, candid and natural feel, professional photography, wide 16:9

styles.name: Creative Movement
styles.tagline: Discover rhythm through imagination
styles.cardDescription: No technique pressure — just music, movement, and creativity. The perfect first dance experience.
styles.fullDescription: Creative Movement is the ideal starting point for young children. There are no rigid steps to memorise — instead, children explore how their bodies respond to music, rhythm, and imagination. Classes use games, stories, and props to make movement feel natural and joyful. It builds body awareness and coordination in a completely pressure-free environment.
whatYoullLearn: Listening to music and responding with movement
Spatial awareness — moving safely in a shared space
Basic rhythm and timing
Body coordination and balance
Confidence expressing yourself through movement
styles.whoItsFor: Best for children aged 5–8, especially those with no prior dance experience. Also great for shy or anxious children who need a gentle, playful introduction.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Creative Movement classes for kids at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Chinese Malaysian child aged 6–8, arms spread wide in joyful free movement, bright mirrored dance studio, colourful clothing, natural warm lighting, movement blur, genuine happiness, professional photography, 3:2

styles.name: Ballet Basics
styles.tagline: Grace, posture, and the joy of classical movement
styles.cardDescription: Foundational classical technique — building posture, musicality, and discipline in a fun, pressure-free setting.
styles.fullDescription: Our Ballet Basics classes for kids introduce the foundations of classical dance in a fun, age-appropriate way. We focus on posture, listening skills, coordination, and the joy of moving to music — not competition or performance pressure. This is not a pre-professional programme. It is designed to give children a strong movement foundation and a genuine love of dance. All classes are flat-shoe only — no pointe work.
whatYoullLearn: Basic ballet positions and terminology
Posture and body alignment
Musicality — moving in time with music
Graceful arm and leg movements
Focus, listening skills, and gentle discipline
styles.whoItsFor: Best for children aged 6–12. No prior experience needed. Particularly suited to children who enjoy structure, elegance, and classical music.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Ballet Basics classes for kids at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Chinese Malaysian girl aged 8–10, basic ballet first position in a mirrored studio, pink leotard, focused and graceful expression, soft studio lighting, clean background, professional photography, 3:2

styles.name: Hip Hop Kids
styles.tagline: Big energy, bigger confidence
styles.cardDescription: High energy, age-appropriate hip hop moves. Builds rhythm, confidence, and personality — zero pressure.
styles.fullDescription: Hip Hop Kids is one of our most popular classes — and for good reason. Children love the music, the moves, and the energy. Our classes teach age-appropriate hip hop choreography, from foundational grooves to basic freestyle elements. Beyond the moves, hip hop builds confidence, stage presence, and the ability to express personality through movement. Classes are fun-first, high energy, and pressure-free.
whatYoullLearn: Basic hip hop grooves and footwork
Age-appropriate choreography to popular music
Freestyle fundamentals
Performance confidence and stage presence
Rhythm and musicality
styles.whoItsFor: Best for children aged 6–12 who love music and movement. No experience required — just energy and enthusiasm.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Hip Hop Kids classes at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Chinese Malaysian boy aged 9–11, hip hop freeze pose in a studio with colourful RGB lighting, baggy streetwear, confident expression, low angle shot, dynamic energy, professional photography, 3:2

styles.name: K-Pop Dance
styles.tagline: Learn the moves your kids already love
styles.cardDescription: Choreography from popular K-pop tracks. Group energy, stage-ready moves, and incredibly fun.
styles.fullDescription: K-Pop Dance classes teach children the choreography styles made famous by Korean pop artists — hugely popular across Malaysia and Southeast Asia. Classes focus on group synchronisation, performance quality, and above all, having fun. Children learn actual choreo from popular tracks, which makes classes immediately exciting and motivating. An excellent way for kids to build teamwork, coordination, and a love of performance.
whatYoullLearn: K-pop style choreography from popular songs
Group synchronisation and timing
Stage presence and performance quality
Coordination and rhythm through structured moves
Teamwork and working with a group
styles.whoItsFor: Best for children aged 7–12. Especially popular with kids who already love K-pop music and videos. No prior dance experience needed.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in K-Pop Dance classes for kids at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Group of Malaysian children aged 8–12, mixed Chinese and Malay ethnicity, matching outfits, synchronized K-pop pose in a bright mirrored studio, joyful and energetic group performance energy, professional photography, 3:2

faqs.question: What age can my child start?
faqs.answer: Our kids classes are designed for children aged 5 to 12. We recommend Creative Movement for the youngest children (5–7) and any style for those aged 8 and above.

faqs.question: Does my child need any prior dance experience?
faqs.answer: Not at all. All of our kids classes are designed for beginners. Children with prior experience are also welcome — classes are paced to accommodate different levels.

faqs.question: What should my child wear?
faqs.answer: Comfortable, stretchy clothing is ideal — leggings, shorts, or tracksuit bottoms. For Ballet Basics, a leotard is preferred but not required to start. Indoor shoes or bare feet are fine. No outdoor shoes on the dance floor.

faqs.question: How long is each class?
faqs.answer: Each class runs for approximately 1 hour.

faqs.question: Can I watch my child's class?
faqs.answer: We have a waiting area for parents. Whether parents can observe the class itself depends on the class — please ask us when you enquire, as some children focus better without parents in the room.

faqs.question: What if my child is shy or nervous?
faqs.answer: Completely normal — and our instructors are experienced with this. We recommend starting with Creative Movement, which is the most relaxed and playful class. Most children warm up very quickly once they see how fun it is.

faqs.question: Is there a trial class option?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our drop-in rate (RM 50 per class) is the easiest way to try before committing to a monthly package. Contact us on WhatsApp to find a suitable class to start with.

faqs.question: Do classes follow school holidays?
faqs.answer: Classes run on a flexible weekly schedule. We keep parents informed of any breaks or changes. Generally, classes continue through school breaks unless otherwise announced.

demographics.name: Teens
demographics.headline: Dance Your Way
demographics.subheadline: Find your style. Build your skills. Classes for teens in Sunway.
demographics.overview: Our teen classes are built for 13 to 17 year olds who want to dance on their own terms. Whether you're into K-pop, hip hop, street jazz, or something more expressive — there is a class for you. No pressure, no judgment. Just good music and real skills.
demographics.whatsappMessage:
Hi! I'm interested in teen dance classes at Dance Connexions.

- Age:
- Dance style interest:
- Any prior experience:

Could you share the schedule and fees? Thank you!
demographics.heroImagePrompt: Group of Malaysian teenagers aged 14–17, mixed Chinese and Malay ethnicity, mid K-pop choreography in a modern mirrored dance studio, synchronized movement, high energy, dynamic studio lighting, editorial photography, wide 16:9

styles.name: K-Pop
styles.tagline: Stage-ready choreo from your favourite tracks
styles.cardDescription: Full group choreography from popular K-pop tracks. High energy, precise, and deeply satisfying to perform.
styles.fullDescription: Our Teen K-Pop classes focus on learning full choreography from current and classic K-pop songs. Classes cover synchronisation, performance quality, facial expression, and the group energy that makes K-pop so compelling to watch. Teens also learn how to break down and retain choreography efficiently — a skill that transfers to all dance styles. Classes are energetic, social, and one of the most rewarding ways to develop as a performer.
whatYoullLearn: Full K-pop choreography from popular current tracks
Group synchronisation and precision
Stage performance quality and facial expression
How to learn and retain choreography efficiently
Confidence performing in a group setting
styles.whoItsFor: For teens aged 13–17 who love K-pop and want to learn real choreography. Suitable from complete beginner to intermediate.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in K-Pop classes for teens at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Malaysian teenage girls aged 14–17, mixed Chinese and Malay, matching dance outfits, synchronized K-pop performance pose in a mirrored studio, vibrant lighting, stage-ready energy, professional photography, 3:2

styles.name: Hip Hop
styles.tagline: Foundation, freestyle, and everything in between
styles.cardDescription: Street-based technique with freestyle elements. Build real hip hop foundations and develop your own style.
styles.fullDescription: Teen Hip Hop classes build real street dance technique — not just moves, but understanding the culture and foundation behind them. Classes cover foundational grooves, musicality, freestyle fundamentals, and building your personal style. This is not just learning choreography — it is about developing genuine hip hop sensibility. If you want to express yourself and have the tools to dance to any song, this is the class.
whatYoullLearn: Hip hop foundation — grooves, isolations, footwork
Freestyle fundamentals and building your own style
Musicality — how to listen and respond to beats
Cypher culture and how to hold your own
Performance presence and confidence
styles.whoItsFor: For teens who want authentic hip hop technique rather than just choreography. All levels welcome — no prior experience needed.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Hip Hop classes for teens at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Chinese Malaysian teen aged 15–17, hip hop groove stance in a professional studio, streetwear, confident and expressive body language, studio lighting, authentic urban dance feel, 3:2

styles.name: Street Jazz
styles.tagline: Where jazz technique meets street attitude
styles.cardDescription: A blend of jazz foundations and street-style movement. Versatile, expressive, and highly performable.
styles.fullDescription: Street Jazz is one of the most versatile and commercially relevant dance styles — seen widely in music videos, performances, and competitions. Our teen classes combine jazz technique (turns, leaps, body isolations) with the attitude and styling of street dance. The result is a style that looks great, feels great, and builds a wide technical range. Great for teens who want to be well-rounded dancers with real performance ability.
whatYoullLearn: Jazz technique fundamentals — turns, leaps, kicks
Street-style attitude, character, and flavour
Body isolations and sharp, clean movements
Commercial choreography style and presentation
Versatility to adapt across different music and moods
styles.whoItsFor: For teens who want technical dance skills with a cool, contemporary edge. Works well for those interested in performing or competitions. Beginner to intermediate.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Street Jazz classes for teens at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Malaysian teenage girl aged 14–17, street jazz pose — sharp body angle, attitude, stylish dancewear, mirrored studio, commercial dance aesthetic, dramatic studio lighting, 3:2

styles.name: Contemporary
styles.tagline: Move with intention. Dance with meaning.
styles.cardDescription: Emotion-driven, artistic movement for teens who want depth and expression beyond set choreography.
styles.fullDescription: Contemporary dance for teens is about more than learning steps — it is about developing your movement voice. Classes explore how to use the body expressively, how movement communicates emotion, and how to move with genuine intention. We blend elements from modern dance, release technique, and improvisation. Ideal for teens who want artistic depth, who already dance and want to grow creatively, or who find traditional structured classes too rigid.
whatYoullLearn: Expressive movement and emotional communication through dance
Modern dance technique and body mechanics
Improvisation and spontaneous movement
Floor work and dynamic use of levels
Developing a personal movement style
styles.whoItsFor: For teens who want artistic expression alongside (or instead of) structured choreography. Some prior movement experience is helpful but not required.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Contemporary classes for teens at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Malaysian teenager, Chinese ethnicity, flowing contemporary dance movement, expressive floor work, soft dramatic studio lighting, artistic and emotional quality, fine art photography style, 3:2

styles.name: Breaking
styles.tagline: Toprock. Footwork. Freeze. Power.
styles.cardDescription: Foundational b-boy and b-girl technique. Toprock, footwork, freezes, and power move basics.
styles.fullDescription: Breaking — also known as b-boying or b-girling — is one of the original hip hop disciplines and is now recognised as an Olympic sport. Our teen classes cover the four fundamentals: toprock (standing movement), footwork (floor patterns), freezes (held positions), and the basics of power moves. Classes teach proper technique and safe conditioning, so students build strength and skill progressively. A physically demanding, deeply individual, and culturally rich style.
whatYoullLearn: Toprock — foundational standing movement and style
Footwork — basic floor patterns (6-step and variations)
Freeze positions — baby freeze, chair freeze
Power move entries and conditioning basics
The culture and etiquette of breaking
styles.whoItsFor: For teens aged 13–17 interested in physical challenge, individual expression, and the culture of hip hop. No prior experience needed. Physical fitness helps but is not required.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Breaking classes for teens at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Malaysian teenage boy aged 14–17, Chinese ethnicity, breaking baby freeze position on studio floor, athletic form, focused expression, dramatic low-angle perspective, professional photography, 3:2

faqs.question: Do I need prior dance experience?
faqs.answer: No experience is needed for any of our teen classes. All styles are taught from foundations upward. If you have prior experience, let us know — we can guide you to the right entry point.

faqs.question: Can I come with friends?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Many students join with friends and it makes classes even more enjoyable. Let us know when you enquire and we will make sure you are in the same class.

faqs.question: Can I try a class before committing?
faqs.answer: Yes. Drop-in at RM 50 per class, no commitment required. Contact us to find out which upcoming class to join as a first session.

faqs.question: What do I wear?
faqs.answer: Comfortable, flexible clothing — tracksuit bottoms, shorts, or leggings. Sneakers or dance shoes for hip hop, breaking, K-pop, and street jazz. Bare feet or socks are fine for contemporary.

faqs.question: Are there evening and weekend classes?
faqs.answer: We schedule classes to work around school hours. Contact us and we will match you with a schedule that works for you.

faqs.question: I want to compete — can the studio help with that?
faqs.answer: We are primarily a training and development space. Students who want to enter competitions can absolutely build their skills here. Speak to us about your goals when you enquire.

faqs.question: How personal are the classes?
faqs.answer: Our classes are focused and personal — not large group fitness-style sessions. Contact us for current availability and scheduling.

demographics.name: Young Adults
demographics.headline: Your After-Hours Studio
demographics.subheadline: Flexible classes, no experience needed. Sunway's dance space for young adults.
demographics.overview: Dance Connexions offers a range of classes for young adults aged 18 to 30 — from social Latin to K-pop, contemporary to heels style. Classes are designed to be fun, accessible, and social. No experience required, and no pressure. Come with friends or come alone and make new ones.
demographics.whatsappMessage:
Hi! I'm interested in young adult dance classes at Dance Connexions.

- Dance style interest:
- Any prior experience:
- Preferred time (day/evening/weekend):

Could you share the schedule and fees? Thank you!
demographics.heroImagePrompt: Young Malaysian adults aged 20–28, mixed Chinese and Indian and Malay ethnicity, laughing and dancing together in a spacious professional dance studio, evening warm lighting, lifestyle photography, joyful social atmosphere, wide 16:9

styles.name: Salsa & Latin Social
styles.tagline: Dance with anyone, anywhere
styles.cardDescription: Social Latin dance — Salsa, Bachata, Merengue basics. Partner or solo. Immediately useful at social events.
styles.fullDescription: Salsa and Latin social dance classes for young adults focus on the social dancing experience — the kind you can actually use at parties, events, and social nights. Classes cover Salsa fundamentals (Cuban and LA style), Bachata basics, and Merengue. You do not need a partner to join — classes are designed to work solo or in rotation. The goal is to feel comfortable and confident dancing socially, not to be a competition dancer.
whatYoullLearn: Salsa basic steps and timing (Cuban and LA style)
Bachata fundamentals and close partner connection
Lead and follow technique for partner dancing
How to social dance confidently with anyone
Footwork patterns and Latin body movement
styles.whoItsFor: For young adults who want to dance socially — at events, parties, and social nights. Also great for couples. No partner required to join.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Salsa and Latin Social classes at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Young Malaysian couple aged 22–28, Chinese man and Indian woman, salsa dance close hold in a warmly lit professional studio, joyful expressions, social dance energy, lifestyle photography, 3:2

styles.name: K-Pop
styles.tagline: Learn the choreo, feel the energy
styles.cardDescription: Group K-pop choreography for adults. Trend-forward, social, and a genuinely great workout.
styles.fullDescription: K-Pop classes for young adults go beyond just learning steps — they focus on the full performance package. Classes cover current and classic choreography, group timing and synchronisation, and the performance style that makes K-pop so visually compelling. It is also one of the most social and motivating group classes available — there is a natural energy when a group moves together to music everyone loves. Great for fitness, fun, and making friends.
whatYoullLearn: Full K-pop choreography from current popular tracks
Group synchronisation and timing
Performance presence and expression
Efficient choreography learning techniques
Cardio fitness through sustained dance movement
styles.whoItsFor: For young adults aged 18–30 who enjoy K-pop music and want to learn real choreography in a social setting. All levels welcome.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in K-Pop classes for young adults at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Young adult Malaysian women aged 20–26, mixed Chinese and Malay, group K-pop choreography in a mirrored studio, synchronized and energetic, stylish outfits, performance quality, professional photography, 3:2

styles.name: Contemporary
styles.tagline: Move beyond steps — find your expression
styles.cardDescription: Expressive, flowing movement. A genuine creative outlet for young adults who want depth over choreography.
styles.fullDescription: Contemporary dance for young adults is one of the most rewarding classes we offer. Less about learning fixed choreography and more about developing real movement skill and personal expression. Classes combine modern technique, improvisation, partnering, and floor work. Many students find contemporary to be both physically satisfying and genuinely therapeutic — a real outlet for stress and emotion.
whatYoullLearn: Modern and contemporary technique foundations
Movement improvisation and personal expression
Floor work and dynamic use of levels
Partner work and contact improvisation basics
Body awareness and release-based movement
styles.whoItsFor: For young adults who want artistic expression and movement depth. Some prior movement background is helpful but not required.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Contemporary classes at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Young Malaysian woman aged 22–28, Chinese ethnicity, contemporary dance floor work, expressive and flowing movement, soft dramatic studio lighting, artistic photography, emotional quality, 3:2

styles.name: Hip Hop
styles.tagline: Real technique, real culture, real fun
styles.cardDescription: Foundational hip hop technique with freestyle elements. Build real skills and develop your own style.
styles.fullDescription: Our young adult Hip Hop classes focus on building genuine hip hop dance technique — not just performing set choreography, but understanding the movement vocabulary and developing individual style. Classes cover foundational grooves, isolations, footwork, freestyle, and the cultural context of hip hop. High energy but structured, with real skill progression. A great workout and a great social activity.
whatYoullLearn: Hip hop foundations — grooves, toprock, footwork
Freestyle technique and developing personal style
Musicality and beat-matching
Improvisation and cipher culture
Cardio fitness through high-energy movement
styles.whoItsFor: For young adults who love hip hop music and culture. All levels from total beginner welcome.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Hip Hop classes at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Young Malaysian man aged 22–28, Chinese ethnicity, hip hop groove in a professional dance studio, authentic street style clothing, confident body language, studio lighting, urban dance culture feel, 3:2

styles.name: Heels Style
styles.tagline: Confidence. Strength. Command the room.
styles.cardDescription: Empowerment-focused feminine movement. Heels or flats — it is about how you carry yourself.
styles.fullDescription: Heels Style classes focus on confident, powerful feminine movement. The class is not about the shoes (flats are absolutely fine) — it is about the quality of movement: deliberate, commanding, and expressive. Classes draw from jazz, commercial dance, and sensual Latin movement, combining technical foundations with an emphasis on confidence and presence. One of our most empowering classes.
whatYoullLearn: Feminine movement technique — isolations, extensions, presence
Commercial choreography with attitude and character
Body confidence and stage presence
Strength and balance — with or without heels
How to carry yourself with intention and power
styles.whoItsFor: For women aged 18–30 who want to develop confidence and powerful feminine movement. No prior dance experience required.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Heels Style classes at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Malaysian woman aged 22–30, Chinese ethnicity, heels style dance pose in a mirrored studio, confident and powerful feminine presence, seen from behind or side angle, dramatic studio lighting, high heels, 3:2

faqs.question: I've never danced before — is this still for me?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Most of our young adult students start with zero dance experience. Our classes are designed to take you from no experience to real skill. The only requirement is showing up.

faqs.question: What if I have two left feet?
faqs.answer: Everyone feels that way at first. Two or three classes in and most students are surprised by how quickly they progress. There is no such thing as someone who fundamentally cannot dance — just people who haven't started yet.

faqs.question: Are there evening and weekend classes?
faqs.answer: Yes. We schedule classes to suit working and student schedules. Contact us and we will find a time that works for you.

faqs.question: Can I bring a friend?
faqs.answer: Yes — and we encourage it. Classes are more fun with friends. Let us know when you enquire and we will put you in the same session.

faqs.question: Is this more like cardio or actual dance?
faqs.answer: Genuine dance — you will get a workout, but the focus is on skill and enjoyment, not burning calories. That said, regular classes are excellent exercise.

faqs.question: Do I need a partner for Salsa?
faqs.answer: No. Our Salsa classes are designed to work with or without a fixed partner. You will learn lead and follow technique, which means you can dance with anyone.

faqs.question: How quickly will I learn?
faqs.answer: Most students feel comfortable with the basics within 4–6 classes. Progress varies by style and individual — consistent attendance is the biggest factor.

demographics.name: Adults
demographics.headline: Dance at Your Own Pace
demographics.subheadline: Expert-led classes in Sunway, designed around your schedule.
demographics.overview: Our adult classes are designed for people aged 30 to 55 who want to learn dance properly — not rush through beginner content, but genuinely develop skill and real enjoyment. Classes are structured, quality-focused, and flexible. We understand you have a busy life. Our scheduling works around you.
demographics.whatsappMessage:
Hi! I'm interested in adult dance classes at Dance Connexions.

- Dance style interest:
- Any prior experience:
- Preferred schedule (day/evening/weekend):

Could you share the schedule and fees? Thank you!
demographics.heroImagePrompt: Chinese Malaysian couple in their late 30s to early 40s, practicing ballroom dance hold in a professional studio, elegant posture and frame, warm studio lighting, mirrors visible in background, graceful and refined, editorial photography, wide 16:9

styles.name: Ballroom & Latin
styles.tagline: Elegant, structured, and deeply satisfying
styles.cardDescription: Cha-Cha, Waltz, Rumba, and more. Proper ballroom technique taught for adult beginners and intermediates.
styles.fullDescription: Ballroom and Latin classes for adults cover the core social and competitive dance styles — Waltz, Foxtrot, Cha-Cha, Rumba, and Samba. Classes are taught with proper technique from the start, building a real foundation rather than just surface moves. The teaching here draws on over 30 years of competitive ballroom experience — so what you learn is genuine, structured, and correctly grounded. Classes are structured but not intimidating.
whatYoullLearn: Waltz — timing, rise and fall, natural turn basics
Cha-Cha — Latin timing, hip action, basic patterns
Rumba — the slow Latin style, timing and expression
Lead and follow technique for partner dancing
Posture, frame, and the feeling of partnership connection
styles.whoItsFor: For adults who want to learn proper ballroom and Latin technique — for personal enjoyment, social events, or eventual competition. Beginner to intermediate.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Ballroom and Latin classes for adults at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Chinese Malaysian couple aged 38–48, waltz hold in a professional mirrored studio, elegant posture and connection, formal-ish but not competition, warm studio lighting, graceful movement, 3:2

styles.name: Salsa
styles.tagline: The most social dance you will ever learn
styles.cardDescription: Cuban and LA style Salsa — partner or solo. Practical, fun, and immediately useful at social events.
styles.fullDescription: Adult Salsa classes focus on building real social dancing ability — the kind that lets you walk into any Latin social event and dance confidently. We cover both Cuban style (circular, rhythmic) and LA style (in a line, more theatrical), with structured progression through partner rotation and regular freestyle practice. Skills become natural, not just memorised sequences.
whatYoullLearn: Salsa basic timing and step patterns (Cuban and LA)
Bachata fundamentals
Partner connection and lead/follow technique
Social dance confidence and etiquette
Footwork variations and simple turn patterns
styles.whoItsFor: For adults who want to dance socially — at parties, events, or social dance nights. Solo or with a partner. All levels from beginner.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Salsa classes for adults at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Malaysian couple aged 35–45, mixed Chinese and Malay, salsa dance in a professional studio, warm lighting, social dance joy, mid-turn moment, lifestyle photography, 3:2

styles.name: Contemporary
styles.tagline: Movement with meaning, at any age
styles.cardDescription: Expressive, technique-grounded movement for adults. A creative outlet that builds real physical skill.
styles.fullDescription: Contemporary dance for adults is both an artistic practice and a physical one. Classes build genuine movement technique — body mechanics, coordination, spatial awareness, and the ability to move with intention and expression. The style draws from modern dance, release technique, and improvisation. For adults who want a creative physical outlet that is distinctly different from the gym, contemporary dance is deeply rewarding.
whatYoullLearn: Modern dance technique — alignment, coordination, transitions
Movement improvisation and personal expression
Floor work and the use of gravity in movement
Breath and physical release as movement tools
Creative composition and individual movement voice
styles.whoItsFor: For adults aged 30–55 who want artistic and physical depth. Prior movement experience is helpful but the class is open to committed beginners.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Contemporary classes for adults at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Malaysian woman aged 38–48, Chinese ethnicity, contemporary dance movement — expressive and grounded, soft dramatic studio lighting, artistic and intentional, editorial photography, 3:2

styles.name: Barre Fitness
styles.tagline: Ballet-inspired fitness. Low impact, high results.
styles.cardDescription: Posture, core strength, and flexibility — ballet technique applied as fitness. No dance experience needed.
styles.fullDescription: Barre Fitness applies the principles of ballet technique — small controlled movements, core engagement, and postural alignment — as a fitness practice. No dance experience required. Classes work through sequences that target core strength, leg endurance, flexibility, and posture. Low impact and highly effective. Particularly popular with adults who want a challenging workout that also improves how they stand, move, and feel day to day.
whatYoullLearn: Core strength and abdominal engagement
Leg strength and endurance through controlled sequences
Posture correction and body alignment
Flexibility and controlled stretching
Balance and body awareness
styles.whoItsFor: For adults of any fitness level who want a low-impact but genuinely challenging workout. No dance experience needed at all.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Barre Fitness classes at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Malaysian women aged 35–50, mixed Chinese and Malay ethnicity, barre exercise positions at a studio barre, focused and elegant, bright professional studio lighting, workout attire, 3:2

faqs.question: Am I too old to start dancing?
faqs.answer: No. We have students who started in their 40s and 50s with no prior experience who are now confident, capable dancers. Age is never a barrier — consistency is what matters.

faqs.question: How long before I can dance properly?
faqs.answer: For social dancing — Salsa, Ballroom basics — most adults feel comfortable within 8–12 classes. For more technical styles, the journey is longer but the progression is clear and measurable.

faqs.question: I have a bad knee or back — are classes suitable?
faqs.answer: Please speak to us before joining. Many of our classes are low impact and can be adapted for physical limitations. We can guide you to the most suitable class and flag any considerations to your instructor.

faqs.question: Can my spouse or partner join the same class?
faqs.answer: Yes, and for Ballroom and Salsa it is ideal. You do not need to bring a partner — but if you do, it accelerates progress for both of you.

faqs.question: What is the difference between group and private sessions?
faqs.answer: Group classes are structured sessions with other students — great for social learning and consistent progress. Private sessions give one-on-one time to work on specific goals or progress at your own pace. Many students do both.

faqs.question: Do you offer Ballroom for absolute beginners?
faqs.answer: Yes. Our Ballroom and Latin classes start from the very beginning. You do not need to know anything to start — not even what a Cha-Cha is.

demographics.name: Active Adults
demographics.headline: Keep Moving. Keep Dancing.
demographics.subheadline: Gentle, welcoming classes designed for active adults in Sunway.
demographics.overview: Our Active Adults classes are designed for people aged 55 and above who want to keep moving, stay social, and enjoy dance in a gentle, welcoming environment. Classes are paced carefully with full attention to comfort and safety. No prior dance experience needed — and absolutely no pressure.
demographics.whatsappMessage:
Hi! I'm interested in active adult dance classes at Dance Connexions.

- Dance style interest:
- Any health considerations we should know:
- Preferred schedule:

Could you share the schedule and fees? Thank you!

styles.name: Ballroom Basics
styles.tagline: The joy of ballroom, at your pace
styles.cardDescription: Waltz, Foxtrot, and ballroom basics taught gently. Posture, grace, and genuine enjoyment — no competition pressure.
styles.fullDescription: Ballroom Basics for Active Adults brings the elegance and joy of ballroom dance to older students in a gentle, structured class. We cover Waltz, Foxtrot, and selected basics at a pace that allows real learning without physical strain. The focus is on posture, partnership, and the genuine pleasure of moving well to music — not competition or performance. Classes are social, friendly, and one of the most enjoyable ways to stay active.
whatYoullLearn: Waltz — basic timing, natural turn, and footwork
Foxtrot — slow, smooth, and highly accessible
Posture and body alignment for comfortable, confident dancing
Partner connection and basic lead/follow
Musicality — moving in time with live and recorded music
styles.whoItsFor: For adults aged 55 and above, with or without a partner. No prior dance experience required. Physically gentle and fully accessible.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Ballroom Basics classes for active adults at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Chinese Malaysian couple aged 62–70, gentle waltz hold in a bright studio, graceful and relaxed posture, warm lighting, smiling and enjoying movement together, lifestyle photography, 3:2

styles.name: Line Dancing
styles.tagline: No partner needed — just good music and good company
styles.cardDescription: Fun group line dancing — no partner required. Great for memory, coordination, and social connection.
styles.fullDescription: Line Dancing is one of the most accessible social dance forms for older adults — and one of the most enjoyable. No partner is required. Classes are done in lines, everyone learning and performing the same patterns together. The social atmosphere is warm and inclusive. Line dancing is genuinely good for cognitive health — the patterns engage memory, coordination, and focus. Classes are beginner-friendly and immediately fun.
whatYoullLearn: Classic and modern line dance patterns and sequences
Footwork patterns — grapevines, shuffles, step-touches
Directional changes and sequence memory
Coordination and timing to music
Social connection through shared movement
styles.whoItsFor: For adults aged 55 and above. No partner needed. No experience needed. One of our most social and accessible classes.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Line Dancing classes at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Group of Malaysian active adults aged 58–72, mixed Chinese and Malay, in a line formation dancing together in a bright studio, smiling and moving in sync, community warmth, lifestyle photography, 3:2

styles.name: Latin Rhythm
styles.tagline: Feel the beat. Move with it.
styles.cardDescription: Cha-Cha and Rumba basics at a relaxed, gentle pace. Fun, rhythmic, and wonderfully social.
styles.fullDescription: Latin Rhythm classes for Active Adults introduce the joy of Latin dance — Cha-Cha and Rumba primarily — at a pace appropriate for older students. The focus is on rhythm, footwork, and the pleasure of moving to Latin music, not technical precision or competition. Classes are warm, social, and genuinely fun. Latin dancing is well known for its benefits to balance and coordination — and these classes deliver those benefits in a completely enjoyable way.
whatYoullLearn: Cha-Cha basic timing and step patterns
Rumba — the slow, expressive Latin style
Latin body movement (introduced gently and progressively)
Simple footwork patterns
Rhythm and musicality through Latin music
styles.whoItsFor: For adults aged 55 and above who want to enjoy Latin music and movement. With or without a partner. All levels welcome.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Latin Rhythm classes for active adults at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Chinese Malaysian couple aged 60–68, gentle Cha-Cha steps in a bright studio, smiling and relaxed, warm soft lighting, rhythmic energy without strain, lifestyle photography, 3:2

styles.name: Social Dance
styles.tagline: Dance for the joy of it
styles.cardDescription: A gentle mix of partner dances — Foxtrot, Slow Waltz, easy social steps. Community and connection first.
styles.fullDescription: Social Dance is our broadest class for Active Adults — a gentle, friendly class covering a relaxed mix of easy partner dances including Foxtrot, Slow Waltz, and simple social steps from various styles. The emphasis is entirely on enjoyment, connection, and community. Content adapts to what the group enjoys. If you want to move, be social, and have fun with like-minded adults, this is the class. Many students describe it as the highlight of their week.
whatYoullLearn: Foxtrot and Slow Waltz basics
Simple partner dance patterns and connections
Social dance etiquette and confidence
Light footwork and gentle movement sequences
Connection with partners and the group
styles.whoItsFor: For adults aged 55 and above who want gentle movement and social connection above all else. All levels welcome. Partner or no partner.
styles.whatsappMessage: Hi! I'm interested in Social Dance classes for active adults at Dance Connexions. Could you share the schedule? Thank you!
styles.imagePrompt: Small group of Malaysian active adults aged 60+, mixed Chinese and Malay, social dancing together in a warm bright studio, genuine connection and joy, some in partner hold, community feel, lifestyle photography, 3:2

faqs.question: Do I need a dance partner?
faqs.answer: No. All of our Active Adult classes can be attended without a partner. In partner-based classes, we rotate or adapt for solo participants. If you have a partner, bring them — it is even more enjoyable.

faqs.question: Is it physically demanding?
faqs.answer: Our Active Adult classes are designed to be gentle and low-impact. We move at a pace that allows everyone to participate comfortably. Over time, regular dancing does build fitness, balance, and coordination.

faqs.question: What if I have a health condition?
faqs.answer: Please let us know when you enquire. Many conditions are no obstacle to dancing — but we want to be informed so we can guide you appropriately. We recommend consulting your doctor if you are unsure.

faqs.question: What do I wear?
faqs.answer: Comfortable clothing and soft-soled indoor shoes. Avoid thick rubber soles that may grip the floor. Leather-soled or smooth-soled shoes are ideal for ballroom styles.

faqs.question: How personal are the classes?
faqs.answer: Our classes are small and personal — not large group fitness-style sessions. Contact us for current availability.

faqs.question: Is this social? Will I meet people?
faqs.answer: Very much so. Our Active Adult classes are some of our most social sessions. Many students have formed lasting friendships through classes here.

faqs.question: I used to dance years ago — can I pick it up again?
faqs.answer: Absolutely, and you will probably be surprised how quickly it comes back. Muscle memory is very real. Students who danced in the past typically progress faster even after long breaks.
